awd_abstract_narration: This award supports a College Faculty Research Opportunity Award                                                                                                (ROA).  The principal investigator, Dr. Nora Sabelli, senior                    research scientist at the National center for Supercomputing                    Applications (NCSA) will be working with Prof. Linda McDonald,                  Asst. Prof. Physics Dept., North Park College.  Prof. McDonald is                                                                                               completing her Ph.D thesis research at NCSA on the calculation of                                                                                               potential energy curves for negative ion resonances using bound-                                                                                                state methods.  This collaboration with Dr. Sabelli and the use of                                                                                              the CRAY 2 supercomputer at NCSA will allow Prof. McDonald to                   generate the basic sets, molecular orbitals and configuration lists                                                                                             necessary to her research.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
